required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound Study by Texturization as a Predictor of Pregnancy in Oocyte Donation Programs
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Study Through Uterine Texturization to Predict Pregnancy After Blastocyst Transfer in Patients Undergoing Hormone Replacement Therapy (HRT) Cycles With Donor Oocytes

brief_summary.textblock: This study is focused on analysing the application of ultrasound scanning techniques as new biomarkers in reproductive medicine. Those biomarkers are based on the analysis of ultrasound texture in different areas of uterine tissue, using 2D/3D ultrasound scanning. Investigators will use the algorithm Text® to analyse the ultrasound texture of the endometrium and myometrium. The aim of the project is to study if it is possible to obtain measurable, objective and reproducible data in healthy volunteers which can be used to predict pregnancy and determine the best moment to perform embryo transfer in assisted reproductive technology (ART) cycles

primary_outcome.description: Detection of gestational sac through ultrasound scanning indicating clinical pregnancy

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to one month after embryo transfer
primary_outcome.description: Interruption of pregnancy after a positive result in the beta HCG test

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 20 weeks after embryo transfer
primary_outcome.description: Interruption of pregnancy after confirming clinical pregnancy using ultrasound scanning
Positive result in beta HCG test indicating pregnancy
Level of beta HCG in the test performed to detect pregnancy

arm_group.description: Application of ultrasound texturization (2D/3D ultrasound scanning)

intervention.description: Along several visits to the clinic, the patients will be subjected to 2D/3D ultrasound scanning.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index (BMI) between 18 and 30 kg/m2
- Not taking the contraceptive pill in a previous cycle
- Non-pregnant: beta human chorionic gonadotropin (HCG) test with negative result at the beginning of the study)
- No previous history of inflammatory diseases, circulatory diseases, abdomen or pelvic diseases
- Physical gynecological exploration without pathological findings
- Gynecological ultrasound study of the uterus with a normal result
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ultrasound studies with technical defects in image acquisition
- Simultaneous participation in other studies
- Previous participation in other study which can affect the results of the present study
